Trikari (Oscar Performance)

Featured

Posted by in American Bloodstock, race horse breeding

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Hail to Reason, Marchetta, Oscar Performance, Turn To

Come the sense of wonder when an old mare sells cheap & her best colt competes its will to win & display sensational turn of foot. https://digital.fasigtipton.com/sales/entry/808/dynamic-holiday

Trikaria 3yo colt by Oscar Performance from dam Dynamic Holiday ex-Harlan’s Holiday.

🐴Pedigree (link)

Pedigree Notes

Dam, Dynamic Holiday distaff from the female family 1-W, Marchetta family line. The furthering to its female relationship distaff @Turn-To 9x thru Sir Gaylord & Hail to Reason – major sire lines dominant. Therein, focuses 4×5 Roberto + 6×5 Halo sire of Glorious Song and dam of Rahy & b/m sire to Harlan (USA). Additionally, @ Turn-To male descendant in sire Homing (GB) as 5th dam sire. Basically, the collective-mass built to Marchetta (f.f.1-W).

Nashua’s influence displays in 2x Roberto through his dam Bramalea & Mr Prospector in Oscar Performance’s 2nd dam. Come revelation that William the Third son Willonyx tails to Hall of Fame, Johnstown (USA) broodmare sire of Nashua.

@sire G1 winner at 2, 3, & 4 yrs Oscar Performance – @Turn-To 6x > 4x Hail to Reason. Top and bottom… Hail to Reason sire lineage impacts both sire and dam.

https://www.bloodhorse.com/stallion-register/stallions/170569/oscar-performance)

Like father, like son the phenotype and genotype hugely appeals. The Marchetta family is widely known for Derby, Oaks and Guineas success and such mare lines in Marchetta shall always stay notable.

Bedtime Story (by Frankel)

Featured

Posted by in race horse breeding, William the Third

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Frankel, Galileo

2yo filly Bedtime Story – Frankel from Mecca’s Angel (IRE) ex-Dark Angel (IRE)

🐴🐴Pedigree link

The 15-year-old son of Galileo, the remarkable Frankel is the stallion untouched. From an outstanding performer to his exceptional breeding profile, there he goes as equine royalty.

https://www.racecafe.co.nz/forums/index.php?/topic/105772-the-incomparable-frankel-plus-a-photo-of-the-day-our-joan-went-to-see-him/

The female distaff family (f.f.2-o) spotted to ancestor Paigle (USA) merits Creator (Tapit) – a Gr.1 winner at 3 of the Arkansas Derby & Belmont Stakes and went exported for stud-duty in Japan. In distaff it has also produced track record holder Moonsplash (Boldnesian) notable sire in quarter horses with pedigree @3x Plucky Leige > 6x Spearmint by Carbine.

In quest for racing excellence – speed merged to high-class stamina Bedtime Story is not alone @3×4 Northern Dancer – 5×5 Mr Prospector: it is a case of furthering probable genetic carriers to an inner co-affinity and with all else, its desired electric prepotency.

Trace a gradual metamorphosis in the fortunes of various lines. Ross du Bourg

Broodmare sire Dark Angel

‘Just this quick snapshot of the stars of Dark Angel’s first runners tells the tale of what was to come: a torrent of horses who came to hand early and then thrived on their racing, continuing to improve as they got older.’ 👉credit reference Article https://www.thoroughbreddailynews.com/the-soaring-success-of-dark-angel/

The dam – Mecca’s Angel

She’s so fast over 5 (trainer) 👇👇

Past & evolved pedigrees are each significant yet ultimately become much more to inwardly invest a very powerful pedigree.

Bedtime Story – dam’s 2nd dam sire Atraf (GB) has in distaff > William the Third daughter William’s Pride with that of Carbine daughter- her 2nd dam as affixed family 7. ATRAF sire line at 3rd dam of Music Boy heads to Tehran & again, Williams’s Pride dam of Town Guard (GB).

Significantly sire Frankel with influence in Roan Rocket’s sire – Buisson Ardent (FR) 4th dam Hark Forrand by King William (William the Third) 5th dam Carbine daughter Stop Her also affixed family 7.

ATRAF – Bedtime Story’s 2nd dam sire

Influences to William the Third shall advance reinforcement thru numerous lines as so specified. Carriers in distaff to William the Third come upon 3 close-related females Gravity, Florence, Contessini & Pitti f.f.2-e.

➡️(link) 👉William the Third 👈by St Simon.

Bedtime Story has plentiful in William the Third influence + crossed with the highly influential Carbine/Spearmint. Approximately (almost) 40 strains @William the Third viz, Gravity, Florence, Pitti and her daughter Contessina.

@janebielski (researcher) The Thoroughbred Link ©️

a poet’s script – Puchkine (FR)

Featured

Posted by in race horse breeding

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Court Martial, So You Think, Starspangledbanner, Vain, Zamazaan

3yo colt Puchkine – Starspangledbanner (AUS) – Vadyska (IRE) ex- So You Think

https://www.pedigreequery.com/puchkine

Son of Choisir (AUS) Starspangledbanner stallion went from earlier fertility issues to the fortuitous sire. https://www.thoroughbreddailynews.com/the-remarkable-journey-of-starspangledbanner/

His sprinting stars are indescribable. Having often wondered what are the intrinsic roots making their remarkable influence, we went by evaluating close female relationships and came to uncovering a genetic parallelism. And once again by probing Black Caviar and Winx. Further, what went found acquaints old racing stars: Phar Lap, Donatello, Beppo (Marco), Shirley Heights (3x Pitti + 3x William the Third) where their stand-out influence comes helpful to finer appreciating the sire Starspangledbanner through VAIN & 4th dam sire Zamazaan + Gold Sovereign broodmare sire William of Valence (Fr) by Vatout (Fr).

The newer profound influence through 2 closely-related dams (f.f.2-e) Pitti progeny & Gravity dam of William the Third (St Simon) & thereof, Felstead, Carbine male-line descendant. To uncover the complex significance, it is necessary to recover its elite similar arrangement upon four-time Champion Australian Racehorse of the Year, Winx & World champion sprinter of 135 rating, Black Caviar.

Winx – the relevance of William the Third & Pitti

Nassau- a son by **William the Third, his daughter Sebenico grand-dam of Theico, the 3rd dam of Vegas Street. A further gentic-affinity in Donatello as 2nd dam sire in Sovereign Edition, with further affinity-female strains to Tehran + Count Fleet in Voodoo Rhythm (USA). 4x William the Third viz Dutch Mary, Mangalmi, Nassau, Sebenico. 4x Count Fleet – Prince John/Hold Your Peace & Riverman & Mr Prospector. Bahram in Hethersett & son Persian Gulf, Donatello in High Hat & sire Alycidon, Bois Roussel by Vatout to Hornbeam, Bellini (ITY) from Minnow by William the Third to Hoist the Flag, Bellini’s male line descendant.

Black Caviar – the relevance of William the Third & Pitti

2 daughters by William the Third – Third Trick & Comparison in Felstead + Desert Sun/6th dam in Felstead. William the Third sire of Winkipop (thru Court Martial) Bahram sire of Big Game, Donatello sire of Alycidon + grand-sire in Solderini where Solderini’s 2nd dam sire has Atout Maitre (Fr) by Vatout. Bois Roussel by Vatout in Hornbeam + Bois Roussel/Vatout the sire of Migoli with his b/m sire Bahram again in Desert Sun. Bois Roussel by Vatout, sire of Tehran >Kurdistan 4th dam sire Bel Esprit, sire of Black Caviar.

**William the Third (essential detail @ link, William the Third)

More on the sire, Starspangledbanner (AUS) than what can be believed!

With antipodean blessings for breeders, Zamazaan served both Australia and New Zealand to become a Champion sire of Stayers to likes of multiple Gr.1 winner Beau Zam (5x William the Third thru Dutch Mary (Donatello)/Minnow to Bellini (ITY), Mangalmi (Sovereign Edition) + with dominance in Carbine‘s influence. Zamazaan sired Veloso (Sydney Cup Gr.1 & AJC Spring Handicap Gr.1 winner – Good Lord double winner of the Wellington Cup Gr.1. Multiple G1 winner Lord Reims (NZ) & Lord Relic (NZ) sight, b/m sire Bismark > Wilwyn 3×4 William the Third.

Vain/Zamazaan + Gold Sovereign b/m sire William of Valence (Vatout) @Starbangledbanner cross Darshaan son of Shirley Heights (Count Fleet + Vatout) + Tehran/Bois Roussel by Vatout + Felstead, Court Martial in Long Row 2nd dam sire of So You Think. Pinza (b/m sire Donatello). Further evaluated below…

Puchkine’s 3rd dam Patrimony by Cadeaux Genereux, European 3yo champion sprinter. Cadeaux Genereux same female family as Desert Sun, (b/m sire Black Caviar) hence Donatello & Bois Roussel in L’anguissola . Felstead, Tehran/Bois Roussel in Sharpen Up. Tamerlane – male line to Bahram, in Young Generation

4×4 Danehill i) sire Danzig 3rd dam by Felstead, his 2nd dam of William the Third. Danehill b/m sire His Majesty, the 4th sire Bellini (Ity) has 3rd dam Minnow by William the Third.

It is a privilege to show full measure of the St Simon son William the Third, to the dam family in Gravity, Pitti & Contessina – an old classic staying family but perhaps more true its mercurial ‘turn of foot’.

And for the breeding wise – https://www.thoroughbreddailynews.com/haras-de-beaumont-buys-into-jean-prat-winner-puchkine/

@janebielski (researcher) The Thoroughbred Link (copyright)

Beauty Waves (Starspangledbanner – Little Sweetheart) as above discussed Vain/Zamazaan & Pitti, the dam conduit in Herbager & Mr Prospector.

taking up: Cosmic Speed SAF (Querari)

Featured

Posted by in race horse breeding, The Thoroughbred Link

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Court Martial, Fair Trial, Hyperion, Lyphard, Surumu

3yo gelding: Cosmic Speed (Querari – Cosmic Dream (Saf) ex- Silvano (Ger).

The pedigree places 5×4 Lyphard + 4×5 Surumu where a continuing impact of these two sires can easily be described as dominant.

Working deep to these above lines revolves their genetic re-appearance with formidable bloodlines as described below,

Lyphard (Nothern Dancer) dam Goofed by i) Court Martial ii) 5×5 Chouberski (#BT)

Surumu – a Bay Ronald sire line – Tantieme – Relic – Hyperion

As “nuts and bolts,” pedigree the lineages have extensive influences yet for a certain prominence in the ‘few’ emerge as exceptional.

The principle requires what may exert tremendous influential trait, through the contemporary pedigree, to a well-considered pre-potency quality.

Here, we discuss

🐴Court Martial by Fair Trial (Fairway)

TBL did not know the Court Martial pedigree template was beforehand evident. There was a chestnut stallion by the name of Way In (GB) by Fairway and he was exported to Italy. He produced a good quality steeplechaser by the name of Galatian (GB) and a Italian mare Feiro De Rio. Feiro De Rio was a G1 Oaks winner and produced Feria, a champion 3yo filly in Italy – she produced the US bred Gyr & Berkut (both by Sea Bird). Berkut produced Alydars Best, a G1 winner at 2 years. Gyr produced a G1 winning French bred son, Bon Sang (Fr).

Renowned Pedigree analyst Harold Hampton considered the Fair Trial thoroughbred pedigree as ideal.

Fair Trial – a high class English sprinter-miler who could carry his speed to 10 furlongs. He was a burnished chestnut with a prominent white blaze and three white socks.

Fair Trial – ranks as the most influential all-purpose sire line to make their mark. The Fair Trial line produced outstanding sprinters and milers, in addition to many winners of Derbies, Oak, St Legers, Quineas, weight-forage, 2mile handicaps and ever the Melbourne, Caulfield and Doombden Cups.

Fair Trial was an imposing individual, combining quality and strength who turned a foot out, a trait often discernible in his descendants. He got a consistent stream of good racehorses, whose salient quality was speed, and passed on his beautiful temperament to nearly all of his stock. – John Hislop

The Fair Trial earliest influences are ‘built’ to Cosmic Speed distaff @ 9×8, following on thru his son Court Martial 3rd dam sire of Elliodor (FR) – 2x Goofed – son Petition, 2nd dam sire of Danzig.

Fair Trial son Fairthorne (IRE) was a tremendous influence to the South African studbook as leading sire six times. The male line continued with F.T grandson Damask the 5th dam sire of Cosmic Speed.

(n.b. the classic-speed traits – what serve world calibre distinction are immersed in lines (ie Lyphard’s Court Martial/Goofed/Chouberski) came coeval. The 1951 French bred Court Martial son Affreux who served successfully in Australia, had produced the middle distance freak racing machine Winfreux. Winfreux was a holder of three Australian time records for the old imperial distance through 8 1/2 furlongs 9 furlongs and 11 furlongs and winner of 21 black-type races. Somewhat alike...Winfreux’s sire Affreux by Court Martial – to Chouberski male line in Hotweed (FR) 3rd dam sire at distaff. Hotweed’s siring son Pearlweed was exported to Argentina.

Family photo profiles of Fair Trial (here)

Surumu (Ger)

Leading sire in Germany 1984. A German Derby winner defeating the runner -up by 4 lengths. Ken Mclean (Designing Speed in the Racehorse) points to Surumu’s 3rd dam’s in-breeding to Sierra and Sainfoin (from Sanda) then further to Papyrus. Fair Trial takes 5×5 Sanda through Sainfoin and Sundridge.

Influences @Hyperion thru Owen Tudor ➡️➡️➡️male-descendant , Spanish Air (GB) whom stood in South Africa. Distaff 4th dam, Have Faith 4×5 Owen Tudor. OT ➡️Blushing Groom to the 5x Owen Tudor to multiples 8x Selene, dam of Hyperion.

Refinement is Subtle – 6×6 Herbager sire of Big Spruce (USA) & daughter Ballade (USA) dam of Devil’s Bag, champion 2yo colt. Herbager is 4x5x5 to Phalaris and the b/m sire Sainfoin affinity is apparent. What needs to be pointed out is that Herbager is a male line to Bosworth (from dam Selene) further to male-line Bay Ronald (as noticeably, Surumu).

Surumu x Court Martial 3x male crosses are ‘in’ typology to Bay Ronald.

Here, was a potential stallion from a different sire line that might just suit North American bloodlines. Ken McLean on ‘Bull’ Hancock’s calculated risk to purchase Herbager.

@ The Thoroughbred Link – research

Fairy Godmother (Night of Thunder)

Featured

Posted by in Nijinsky, race horse breeding, The Thoroughbred Link

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Court Martial, GA, Haplotye, Nijinsky

2yo chestnut filly – Fairy Godmother (Night of Thunder – Scintialing ex-Siyouni) Pedigree.

The race-phenotype in Fairy Godmother goes dynamic. She, @7×5 Nijinsky re-echoes his quality to flair, verve, and acceleration.

Genotypic blueprints with compressed power

2x Court Martial via Dancing Brave/Lyphard and 6th dam distaff, hail the f.f.1-P + to, Hornbeam b/m sire of Blakeney.

Further to f.f. 1-P has Mount Hagen (FR), 2nd dam sire of Bohemian Bounty (GB), 2nd dam sire to Fairy Godmother’s dam Scintilating.

(n.b. Our last post updating @ Black Caviar highlights the extraordinary and important influences noted to female family 1-P)

A beautiful horse of superb quality, truly made, sound and possessed of excellent limbs, but with shelly feet a trait which he has handed on…though having a measure of stamina, speed was Court Martial’s forte, which reflected in his stock. An outstanding and wonderfully consistent stallion, his mares have done comparably well at stud. Most of his stock like soft ground. John Hislop

Court Martial 2nd dam sire of Busted (GB) sire of 6×6 Bustino from the Marchetta family. Bustino sired the Reine-de-Course mare Height of Fashion (FR) dam of Nashwan (US), dam of Unfuwain (US) & Nayef (US).

Further @ Fairy Godmother: Marchetta family (f.f.1-W) – 9xTurn-To, Alycidon, Acropolis, Ambiorix collectively #Haplotye L2b1a.

Fairy Godmothers distaff Queen of Light – f.f.1-S.

Fairy Godmother’s 7th dam distaff Queen of Light, and 5th dam to sire Desert Prince (IRE), 2nd dam sire to Night of Thunder.

Familial pattern bred: Court Martial – Picture Play (dam Queen of Light) produced Promulgation, a successful winning two year old exported to America. Promulgation is the b/m sire of Noble Decree (USA) a champion 2 year old in England. Queen of Light daughter Chystal Palace foaled Royal Palace (Ballymoss) 11 starts – 9 wins rated best English 2 year old and winning two of the Triple Crown. Royal Palace was unbeaten as a four year old of 4 starts, G1 races.

The family distaff has produced Hello (Lycius US) champion 2yo in Italy. A 5×5 Court Martial pedigree

The champion French sire : 8x9x7D Tantieme – sire of 🐴Match, 1/2 brother of Relko – (3rd dam sire Desert Prince) and Reliance, has primacy of the genes influence viz. dams influence #GA/GB *Relic – Tourbillon – Papyrus, 👉👉👉 #GA/GB x Byerley Turk x St Angela/Harkaway

3x *Relic distaff (f.f.8f) same to Nijinsky’s ancestress Padua, It is considered the family 8 Haplotype (L3a1b) sources to a Byerley Turk mare – however a 1994 unnamed US mare also sources N1 haplotype. Given Byerley Turk blood is significant in Lyphard’s dam Goofed (5×5 Chouberski), Blakeney, 6x Djebel the ancestral classification shall remain unclear, however an emphasis inclines Byerley Turk ‘relatives’ descendancy – reinforcement undisputed pre-potency. Its (BT) decline is goes toppled by lack of reinforcement somewhere.

Stallions like *Relic, the brilliantly fast, United States bred sprinter who acted as a phenomenal upgrading outcross of the many French, English and Irish bred mares he covered when exported to stand in Europe, are as scarce as hen’s teeth. Relic (by Man o’ War’s intensely inbred son War Relic out of Bridal Colours by Commando’s grandson Black Toney) conquered enormous odds stacked against him. He qualifies as an ancestor who should be consistently repeated in modern pedigrees…. Ross du Bourg

Blood affinities spring up across the world that achieve results far in excess of the norm and ring true again and again – Ross du Bourg – Primacy of the Genes chapter, The Australian and New Zealand Thoroughbred

The Thoroughbred Link @janebielski (researcher)

recapturing… Black Caviar (AUS)

Featured

Posted by in Australian Thoroughbreds, race horse breeding

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Black Caviar, GA, Haplotype, I2a, Vain

Black Caviars don’t come along every day – P. Moody (trainer)

Black Caviar (Aus) – 2010 WTR World Sprinter – a 135 rating 2011 Top Racehorse in the world.

With research upon Haplotype bloodlines, TBL re-examines the Black Caviar pedigree.

Superior quality breeding always utilizes the empyrean influence to St. Simon (by Galopin or Delight which remains still indeterminable, however goes conclusive to Byerley Turk male lineage, see Porter) out of St. Angela from King Tom. Further, the examination of why his lines are a solid source establishes Harkaway on this blog, as further progressed through his son King Tom.

US researcher Kathleen Kirsan advises Harkaway lines were best known for steeplechasers & hunters of the day. Kirsan also introduces the late Alex Fell, an astute writer/researcher of her much-acclaimed ‘Irish Draught Horse’ book – Ireland’s only native breed of horse.

The Irish Draught can be observed in this video. https://www.tiktok.com/@discoverthehorse/video/7385954838997142814

It is not by coincidence… and where expressed by Fell, that a perfect Irish draught mare Horna Honey carries a TB influence through Flying Hackle by b/m sire ***Atheling from a dam by King Tom and this superior bred mare shall make her influence as discussed below.

Black Caviar’s front pedigree, places 3×4 Vain by Wilkes (Court Martial) from dam Sans Taras – a family that is showing up frequently amongst superior Australasian racehorses. (n.b. 0bserve Sans Taras to Le Fabuleux (FR) broodmare sire of Unbridled (USA)

Court Martial (Fair Trial – b/m sire Hurry On) assigns family, f.f. 1-P, same to Black Caviar.

Court Martial distaff @ Winkipop by St Simon’s son William the Third takes 4×4 King Tom by Harkaway.

(n.b. @ Winkipop a full sister to Winkie (GB) – a reasonable and successful stallion that got winners at all distances thru New Zealand and Australia. Best known as b/m sire of Phar Lap.)

Similarly … Black Caviar’s distaff @ Third Trick by William the Third (by S.S) from King Tom daughter Hilarity > 4×4 King Tom by Harkaway

Hornbeam, broodmare sire of Lunchtime, sire of Snippets, sire of Black Caviar’s 2nd dam is another assigned family, f.f. 1-P. Again...Hornbeams 5th dam by St Simon’s son William the Third.

3×4 Vain – his 4th dam Lady Pop has 4 lines to Harkaway via King Tom and Austrey, the grand-dam of sire, Chester (AUS) – 3rd dam sire of Popinjay (Aus). The ancestry to Vain’s distaff ff.A-10 across certain bred-type lines upon Harkaway – *Lexington – Voltigeur + Bend Or, Lord Clifden (“One horse for whom the revised pedigree of Bend Or makes even more significance is the mare Martha Lynn, who was a huge factor in the pedigrees of stallions of the middle of the 19th century onwards” – Porter

*Lexington – the US thoroughbred classic Sire ‘back-bone’ – a 15.3 hands phenotype with untiring ability. The trait stamps exceptionally competitive through broodmare sire of Spendthrift sire of Hastings, sire of Fair Play, sire of Man O’ War, regenerative. The Lexington influence seen to Mata Hari, dam of Spy Song. (take note to extraordinary Phenotype – Lexington photo – https://pastthewire.com/lexington-the-granddaddy-of-them-all/

Mata Hari also carries two further influences which are also to Vain’s pedigree – Darebin (Aus) b/m sire of Commando & Star Ruby (GB) 3rd dam sire of Mata Hari. @ Vain/Lady Pop her granddam by Star Ruby (GB) and her 3rd dam by Darebin (Aus).

Haplotypes:

By Studbook, the female family 1-P branch assigns #Haplotype N2a. The Studbook f.f. 1-P branched from 1-O. However, the #Haplotype at f.f.1-O reveals #I2a (Lady Atheling IRE 1890 by ***Atheling > & this dam takes 4x4x5 Harkaway! Further Lady Atheling is the dam ancestor of an 1994 Australian mare unnamed. (it may be suggested/ possible, this is Scandinavia 1994?? Error at/after Lady Atheling (GB 1890), at/before a 1994 AUS mare

Applying the pre-supposition @ Haplotype #I2a/1, with distaff Black Caviar, shall take further co-affinity with 2x Wilkes dam Sans Taras where the female family 13, assigns #Haplotype I2a1. (MRCA – Milbanke’s Black Mare (GB 1705c) by *Makeless)

Pedigree Query information to *Makeless breeding & https://www.pedigreequery.com/makeless indicates where Type and Cross founders emerged. To PQ informational notes: the #GA/GB with its Chestnut Thornton (family 2) what Harkaway ancestry assigns to.

The #Haplotype I2a/1 indicates its affinity for GoldolphinArabian/Barb male lines. Its 1st foundation below…

The broodmare sire of Court Martial to Hurry On viz.tail-male #GA/GB. Again, #GA/GB Man o’ War daughter Firetop (USA) 5th dam of Nijinsky. Again I2a1 comes distinctive to Reine-de-Course dam Crimson Saint, dam of Royal Academy whom takes 11x St Angela (f.f.11-c, Haplotype I2a1). Further the distaff takes 6x Orme from St Angela’s daughter Angelica (f.f. 11-c, Haplotype I2a1.)

New Zealand breeding and once a market for best stayers with superior classic speed stood its breeding to #GA/B Precipitation male line with its cross to Fair Trial >f.f. 9c – Haplotype L1). Final Orders (NZ) 4x5x5 Hurry On (#GA/GB male line) and 4×3 Fair Trial to daughter Vin D’ Armour 6×5 Mumtaz Mahal > f.f. 9c – Haplotype L1 as 2nd dam of Black Caviar’s sire Bel Esprit.

Black Caviar’s broodmare sire – the genuine sire Desert Sun (sire of wonder mare Sunline (NZ) 48 starts for 32 wins & b/m sire to world-class sprinter Nature Strip (AUS) – 43 starts for 22 wins + notably, Egyptian Raine, La Bella Dama and Moralee) from the global sire line in Green Desert (Danzig) from the Courtly Dee family noting War Admiral by Man O’ War (#GA/GB) to distaff’s family strains developed by Papyrus, Felstead, 5×5 Fairway, sire of Fair Trial (Fairway f.f. 13-e #Haplotype I2a1) & 4sx5s Umidwar; a certain pre-potency inclusive to Desert Sun’s dam Solar > 34x St Simon by Galopin ( or, Delight?) from St Angela by King Tom by Harkaway.

@ The Thoroughbred Link – researcher Jane Bielski

Kingman filly – Sparkling Plenty (FR)

Featured

Posted by in classic thoroughbred pedigree, race horse breeding, The Thoroughbred Link

≈ Leave a comment

Tags

Haplotype, Invincible Spirit, Kingman, L3a1a, Selene

Winner of 2024 G1 Prix de Diane (2100m) 3yo b. filly Sparking Plenty by Kingman from Speralita (Frankel).

European champion Kingman is promoted as the best son of sire of sires Invincible Spirit, out of Classic winner Zenda – a half-sister to leading sire Oasis Dream.

Kingman’s dam runs to the Family 19; a #Haplotype H – to the Herod daughter ancestor broodmare Tuberose. The #Haplotype H to blue blood broodmare Lalun (f.f.19-b) dam of @ 6x6x7 Never Bend (USA), sire of dam Courtly Dee and sire of Mill Reef. The compelling notable to Laluns 4th dam by Carbine (f.f. 2-h Martha Lynn family)

By Haplotype L3a1a, highlights the female family 7-a, distaff to Invincible Spirit + 3x Rockefeller by Hyperion ex- Selene (see, 2x Sharpen Up) affinity to 4×5 Danzig. Upon similarity by relationship of elite broodmare Selene – Serenissma – Gondolette arrives upon the sub-variant, haplotype L3a1b. Another reinforcement f.f.7-a has Espresso 3rd dam of Urban Sea, meshed with other strains f.f. 6-e at Big Game, Sparkling Plenty 6th dam sire Pantheon, Sickle, Mossborough, Bosworth.

Broodmare sire of Busted (GB), Vimy is from family 1-u, L3a1b Haplotype, the affinity to Gondolette. Busted is 4th dam sire to Zenda, dam of Kingman.

Whilst a familial ‘pattern’ affinity maintains integrity of L3a1a/b, the perennial breeding discussions revolve around the delicate balance between avoiding excessive in-breeding or achieving a more favourable alignment with homogeneity values. This presents a complex scenario in which the markers of genotype must be meticulously assessed, striking a considered balance of breeding in relation to the resulting phenotype, which, nevertheless, remains somewhat undeterminable.

By our suggestion… the proficiency of breeding remains plausibly upon refining to multiples, the diversity ‘outside’ in much similar supportive strains which arise and converge as potent crosses. This development eventually advanced upon Danzig & Border Bounty where Border Bounty from a Danish line, Mowerina, gave Invincible Spirit.

Coefficient of Relationship (COR) measures the degree of consanguinity, or biological relationship, between two individuals. The term Coefficient of Relationship (COR) was, like the Coefficient of Inbreeding, defined by Sewall Wright in 1922. https://www.truenicks.com/pedigreestatistics.htm

Inbreeding Coefficient (IC) measures the Inbreeding to 10 generations using Sewall Wright’s F calculation expressed as a percentage value. A low inbreeding coefficient means a low level of inbreeding. The vast majority of Thoroughbreds will have an inbreeding coefficient of less than 10% and inbreeding coefficients over 15% are very rare. https://www.truenicks.com/pedigreestatistics.htm

Sparkling Plenty dam **family 16-c, as is 4th dam sire Faraway Son + Herbager thru Rainbow Quest (Frankel’s 2nd dam sire). Two of the these three to Agnes family lineage are to Voltigeur referencing dam, Martha Lynn. Martha ancestral back… surely influences a peculiar dominance upon Haplotype L4, as to family 2. Haplotype L4 @ Sparkling Plenty pedigree arises through Kris (GB) and 2nd dam sire Dashing Blade (GB) + Spy Song thru 4th dam sire Faraway Son in family 2-o. The grand-dam of Sir Gaylord & Secretariat, Imperatrice, sired by Caruso (USA) is another member to family 2-o. (n.b. Further Danehill impacts #Haplotype L4 via family 2-d branch.)

At **family 16-c by Haplotype are of two mares and here the individuals cannot be validated by Pedigree Studbook Table. The f.f. 16c as irregularities exist to either I2a or L3a1b and another remotely to N haplotype.

In any case the pedigree to Sparkling Plenty as featuring Haplotype L3a1b is crucial.

Princess Sapphire (dec.) by Savabeel (Aus) a 1400m – 1560m winner (race video). Her breeding is 3×4 Sir Tristram, a female family to Selene, Hyperion’s dam, with the Hyperion factor observed to Forli’s male line being 2nd dam of War Front.

Princess Sapphire is the New Zealand distaff family 13-a and noted to #Haplotype L2b1a with significant factor to Harkaway through Vaguely Noble and distaff Philomena, a most distinctive, integral NZ pedigree to King Tom – Angelica – Dreadnought – Musket.

The dam Gem Flight takes critical mass to 3x Hyperion/Selene. Further the 4x3Aurora from Rose Red: the Marchetta 1W family backgrounds to King Lud, a grandson of Harkaway. Additionally, 3x Hermit – leading sire in Britain seven straight years, 1880-1886. He was in the top ten in the broodmare sire lists in England for sixteen years.

Gem Flight her great staying sire Mellay – introduced to New Zealand, the Champion New Zealand sire 1972/73, 2d 1973/74, 3rd 1971/72. A post mortem revealed a heart weighing 15+lbs, bigger than Phar Lap.

Both Mellay and Noble Bijou were unraced. Like many New Zealand studmasters, Brian Anderton did not have the budget to import high class racetrack performers. Instead, he had to take the punt that a top pedigree would compensate for a lack of proven racetrack ability. In the case of Mellay and Noble Bijou, he hit the bullseye. Mellay, a son of Never Say Die, was from the Epsom Oaks and One Thousand Guineas winner Meld. Mellay came to New Zealand in 1965 and the following year his half-brother Charlottown helped the cause by winning the Epsom Derby and being named England’s Horse of the Year. Mellay, who died when 13, was twice champion sire and was the leading broodmare sire five times. Mellay left a host of good stayers, including dual NZ Cup winner Princess Mellay, Swell Time (Caulfield Cup), Rose Mellay (Auckland Cup) and Trelay, while both Mayo Mellay and Bahrain were runner-up in the NZ Derby. (Source and credit: LoveRacingNZ) Further notice: Mellay is 3x Blandford thru Blenheim and Bahram & 5×5 Scarpa Flow (dam of Fairway & Pharos)

Princess Sapphire 3rd Dam by Noble Bijou. Noble Bijou served his first book in 1975, was a Vaguely Noble half-brother to the outstanding race mare, Allez France, who won eight Group I races, including the Arc de Triomphe. Noble Bijou had an even better record, heading the NZ sires’ premiership four times, winning the Dewar Trophy (combined NZ and Australian earnings) once, and, like Mellay, was five times champion broodmare sire. Noble Bijou is also the only stallion in modern times to have been New Zealand’s leading sire and leading broodmare sire in the same season. Noble Bijou owed much of his success to being regularly mated with Mellay mares, a cross that produced six Group I winners – Prince Majestic, Alibhai (four Grp I wins), Powley, Our Sophia, Allez Bijou and Be Noble (dual Grp I winner in South Africa). Noble Bijou also left the talented brothers The Phantom (1994 NZ Horse of the Year) and The Phantom Chance (Cox Plate and NZ Derby) and Caulfield Cup winner Lomondy.

3yo filly, 1000 Guineas G1 winner, Elmalka – (Kingman – Nahrain ex-Selkirk) – Pedigree ,

Elmalka’s 4th dam – New Zealand Horse of the Year La Mer. She had verve and spirit and boasted a fantastic pedigree which was steeped in talent derived from Senor Frederico Tesio’s breeding skills. She would sprint and stay and possessed an uncanny acceleration. She won 24 times from 43 starts.

The New Zealand purchase of Olgiata by Wanganui breeders Mr and Mrs Jack Alexander whom specifically sought Tesio lines, where their chosen mare, was so named after a Tesio property in South Italy. On pedigree Olgiata was a gem. Her background was indicative of Tesio’s propensity to buy and sell stock in his overwhelming desire to upgrade the breed.

Olgiata was by Acropolis fron Tesaura, by Niccolo dell’ Arca from Tokamura, by Navarro from Tofanella, by Appelle. Her 3rd dam, Tofanella, was an example of Tesio’s trading predisposition. Tofanella was bought as a yearling in England by Tesio. As a racehorse Tofanella won three times in Italy and once in Germany before retiring to stud. She was a shy breeder but her offspring were all class. They were headed by the Italian Derby and St Leger winner, Tenerani who later won the Queen Elizabeth Stakes and Goodwood Cup in Britain just after WWII. He was at stud in England and Italy and gained racing immortality by siring for Tesio the unbeaten Ribot considered in some quarters to be the greatest racehorse produced in the 2oth century.

As a racehorse Olgiata was no champion when compared with her illustrious forebears, but those Tesio talents were only resting in her genetical composition. On reaching Wanganui, New Zealand, Olgiata produced a filly foal to Worden II. Named La Balsa, she was speedy and fiery, but experienced a hip-injury and retired to stud without ever racing. Her first foal, by Battle-Waggon, was sold to Australia where she raced as Beach Manner and won races.

Mr Alexander next put La Balsa to Copenhagen II, the mating which was to produce La Mer. By Royal Charger, Copenhagen II was a prepotent type with the flair to revive talents seemingly lying dormant in various pedigree.

While being broken in, La Mer began to really impress. She had brains and quality. I knew then we had a real racehorse on our hands – Malcolm Smith (trainer) recalls. La Mer distance wins, 1400m -2000m.

"she (La Mer) can be expected to influence the international thoroughbred scene for many years". (Jack Glengarry)

Harkaway – the Irish Eclipse, King of the Curragh, & “the terror of all Ireland”

It is remarkable where contemporary bloodstock literature does not adequately consider the full impact of Harkaway in comparison to mainstay genetics of Eclipse and Herod, Whalebone, Whisker.

The Irish Eclipse Harkaway was not an ordinary individual. He was truly exceptional, a marvel. It is to consider well, that he may be the pinnacle of any pedigree, transmitting a distinction from the sole inheritable factor of one ancestral mare.

With performances as noted, she will be highly praised alongside those Matriarch notables.

Alice Hawthorn – 3 to 7 year old, a splendid racer, ran 71 times and won 50+ times inclusive of 17 King’s Plates. First foal at 11 years old, and had 7 foals without a break. 3 Splendid foundation mares, Lady Hawthorn and Sweet Hawthorn + dam of Thormanby.

Catherina by Whisker out of Alecto – a splendid racer. Ran 2-11 years old 176 times and won 81 times. 12 times as an 11 year old. First foal at 16 years old, 9 foals of which 6 where good racers. At 22 years foal Young Catherina/Nagara and at 27 years the last foal a winner at 3years.

Maria – dam of Waxy (1793 Derby, Champion Sire 1810, sire of 190 winners, of Wowski (2nd 1800 Oaks); of top class stayer Worthy, winner of 6 King’s Plates between 1799 and 1801; grandam of Mother Shipton (2nd 1797 Oaks); and of Smolensko (1813 2000 Guineas, Derby). Died 1797, about a fortnight after foaling Wowski. Doric Stakes (2-mile heats) carried 9st 7lbs, winning 3 1lbs over her nearest rival.

Guiccioli (Bob Booty) – 2-6 years old a very good racer. Ran as a 6-year-old after foaling and again in foal producing a healthy foal, six times, won twice in the King’s Plates over 4 miles with heats in September in curragh and in Northumberland Handicap in October amongst such good horses as Skylark, a 3-year-old and Napoleon, a 5-year-old. First foal at 6 years old. 13 foals amongst where Birdcatcher and Faugh-a-Ballagh. At 21, living twins, one which was Gramachree, Foundation mare in family 11-d and at 24 years St John, later Carlow, a good race 2-7 years old. (n.b. Guiccioli 9x to **Siberia > Curlin (USA)

🐴🐴🐴 Alice Hawthorn, Catherina, Maria, Guiccioli. Not merely sources to great dams of great sires where these genetics are power house. The ‘discovered’ mare produced a phenotype that evidently goes overlooked and it was only through Harkaway himself as passed to his son King Tom & his descendants, that distinguishes an ultimate contribution.

But firstly, another well-known mare Pocahontas – esteemed breeder of Stockwell & Rataplan & King Tom. Pocahontas never won a race of 9 starts.

Pocahontas: 2-5 year old ran 9 times without winning. First foal at 6 years,13 foals amongst which were Stockwell, Rataplan, King Tom, The Knight of Kars, Ayacanora, Knight of St Patrick, Auricula (dam of Nuncham & Blanford, Araucaria (dam of Wellingtonia, Camelia, Chamont and Rayon d’Or. Lived to 33 years of age. (n.b. 1909 referenced **)

Comprehending Harkaway – his nucleus: The Godolphin Arabian, the sire of Old England, from Amorett, also known as Little Hartley mare, a Royal mare. One of Old England’s grand-daughters is Mother Brown.

*Mother Brown by Trunnion-Old England. At 4-12 years old, ran 39 races and won 20. As 8 year old, and in foal, she won a race over 4 miles. As a 9 year old, after foaling, ran again four times and won four times (amongst which was a King’s Plate). As a 10 year old ran 6 times, winning twice. As a 12 year old, ran once, not placed. Had 6 foals. At 21, Toby a good racer in Ireland, At 25, Jerry Sneak, a splendid racer in Ireland and won as a 13 year old and was sire of many good racehorses. At 26, Mare by Bagot, the grandmother of Nabocklish, family 4. About 30years old, had last foal. Mother Brown, dam of Bacchus, winner of 31 races between 1791 and 1796 including 3 King’s Plates

Nabocklish – 1815, 1816 x 2, 1817 King’s Plate The Curragh. The Nabocklish mare and only recorded daughter Fanny Dawson is the dam of Harkaway.

Bloodstock writer, George Tattersall (1817-1849) impresses Harkaway was exploited and whether from aristocrat jealously towards the roguish character in owner, Mr Ferguson, it does appear Harkaway attracted an unnecessary misfortune. Harkaway received heavy weights to his racing performances and Stewards would adjudicate faulty starts. Under such harsh conditions to his running, Harkaway earned much respect and praise afar after his triumphant races.

The name of Harkaway is sacrificed to the disgusting practices of an unprincipled third ‘party’.

At stud in his first year, Harkaway only served 3 mares. He served the following season in Newmarket to later return to Ireland, and he produced a good number of quality winners. King Tom was considered much like Harkaway. Harkaway daughters were considered very good and turf writers greatly admired them. Even so, rapidly his stud career did decline as breeding services preferred The Baron, to sire Stockwell and Rataplan.

In this light – one may appreciate how TB History took the evolutionary path.

Finer breeding models are generally to St Simon the Byerley Turk male line. To his pedigree, it maybe comprehended to Harkaway, a Godolphin Arabian/Barb specimen, was a dynamic cross of its time & further St Simon’s dam, St Angela, tap-root family 11-c where his 5th dam Jerboa reveals 7x Godolphin Arabian & 4x Crofts Partner. However, it is not the only aspect influencing. Among those bred-in strains, *Mother Brown (Trunnion – Old England mare) contributes an exemplary trait.

With this focus, what maybe catalysed to any breeding model may be determinable by understanding exactly whom Harkaway has given influence to, & also to Harkaway’s son King Tom through his few descendants outside of St Simon.
